page.title: 01NEWCASTLE Centre and East.
page.content: The SW corner of the rectangle has the{city centre}with hospital, higher education, retail and entertainment facilities and bounded on the east by the{inner urban motorway.} The city centre{Metro}stations lie inside this zone. Due North lies the{Town Moor,} bordered to the East by the flatted and high income Victorian housing sector of{Jesmond.} East lies the incised Ouseburn; wooded urban park of {Jesmond Dene}in the North but with river related{Transitional Zone} functions in the South. The S.E. Northumberland plain continues eastwards through the south-north age zones of the riverside residential{Byker Redevelopment {Scheme,}the Victorian railway yard suburbs of{Heaton}and the thirties semis of{High Heaton.
